**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-01T00:46:43Z" title="07/01/2015 12:46  AM" data-short="9 yr">July 1, 2015</time> by 322997am**

I just can't see how multiplayer is even necessary for KSP.... its a game about building your own unique contraptions and sending them on missions that last years (in game) time. 

I mean, getting people to help collect science? That's like 50% of the game currently right there that you're essentially outsourcing to friends. Helping you build megaships? so you mean I'm handing over a large portion the ship designing to somebody else... no thanks.

Boarding and stealing stuff? Isn't that just Elite... and I'm not even sure how you could even dock with a ship in space piloted by a real person who does not want to be boarded.... I'm not sure its possible to be honest. Even with the Claw, all you'd need to do is accelerate away and its unlikely anybody could catch you. 

I know this is just my personal opinion, but multiplayer should just not be a priority.

> 
> Yeah I am just saying it needs to get more attention

It already has lots of attention. Applying any more dev work would exponentially decrease output of work and quality into multiplayer and decrease the amount of work put into the rest of the game even more.

If you want to rush multiplayer, go try DarkMultiPlayer. It's fun enough, though glitchy.
K done don't read this thread again.

Okay, lets think here. Imagine, you and your friends are playing together, like, you and four friends. One of them is on Mun, driving a rover. One of them is launching a rocket, you and one of them are doing dogfights in Kerbin. The last one is on transit to Eeloo. Of course he wants to timewarp.

How would timewarp work in a physics sandbox game?

Would his warp be for him only? Can you imagine the exploits?

What if Mun roving friend wants to physics warp? Wouldnt you be mad if your sensitive plane suddenly tore itself to pieces?

I really want to know how multiplayer timewarp issue would be resolved. (Sorry if its already resolved by a clever trick)

Going from my example, would you land your plane for your friend to go to Eeloo? Maybe you would because youre a good person. Would your friend youre dogfighting with land and wait? Maybe he would too. Maybe he wouldnt. Those are planes. Easy enough.

But one of your friends is launching a rocket. Would you land your rocket so your friend would go to Eeloo? Maybe your interplanetary friend can wait.. In empty, boring space. Waiting for planes to land, rockets to orbit and rovers to stop.

Edit: But those are simple! What if youre on aerobrake/lithobrake trajectory while your friend is interplanetary? Well you can stop warping with requests (otherwise it would be so.. messy.) And request a slower warp so you can wait until youre close enough to reach the "fun" part like landing. While your friend is still waiting in empty space, warping slowly with you.

Then you request to stop warping and maybe your friend was a bad person/got tired of waiting/went to get snacks so he can wait more. Of course the warp doesnt stop, and you hit the ground at 10x warp.

And quicksave/quickload system..
